subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: ... I am proposing you still compile your production code with 1.4, just use java 5 to compile and run the junit tests. You are proposing that running with the
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 9/13/06, Neil Swingler <neil@...> wrote:
>
>> Surely even if java 5 is not permitted in production code there can be
>> no harm in using it to run a unit testing tool.
>>
>
>
> It's never that simple. There can be administrative reasons (the sysadmin
> team doesn't have time or bandwidth to support two JDK's) and sometimes just
> plain common sense reasons (if you run your tests and your application with
> a different JDK, you might see different results that will be hard to
> diagnose).
>
>
I am proposing you still compile your production code with 1.4, just use
java 5 to compile and run the junit tests. You are proposing that
running with the java 5 libs could possibly give different results (i.e.
a test passes which should have failed). I really cannot see this
happening. Could you think of an example?

- Neil
